    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Configures UI elements

      • processSpriteModeSwitch

        public void processSpriteModeSwitch()
        One of the methods responsible for modifying element positions depending on using animated sprites or not. Using animated sprites requires modifying sizes of some elements.
        See Also:
        BattleController.processSpriteModeSwitch(), AddPokemonController.processSpriteModeSwitch()

      • setParty

        public void setParty(java.util.List<Pokemon> party)

      • setPreviousPane

        public void setPreviousPane(javafx.scene.layout.Pane previousPane)

      • displayPokemonStat

        public void displayPokemonStat(int index)
        Fills the summary screen with information about the currently previewed Pokémon.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the player's party member

      • setPokemonTypes

        private void setPokemonTypes(Pokemon pokemon)
        Fills the type section with information about the currently selected Pokémon's type.
        Parameters:
        pokemon - the party member whose type is to be displayed

      • setPokemonStatistics

        private void setPokemonStatistics(Pokemon pokemon)
        Fills the statistics section with information about the currently selected Pokémon's stats.
        Parameters:
        pokemon - the party member whose statistics are to be displayed

      • setMoves

        private void setMoves(Pokemon pokemon)
        Fills the moves section with information about the currently selected Pokémon's moves.
        Parameters:
        pokemon - the party member whose moves are to be dispalyed

      • prepareMoveInfo

        private void prepareMoveInfo(Move move)
        Prepares move information that is about to be displayed to the player
        Parameters:
        move - move whose information that is about to be displayed

      • setListeners

        private void setListeners()
        Initiates listeners that control the functions of the back, previous and next buttons. They also control the function of the button that closes currently displayed move info (only visible when the info is being displayed).
